intro: Borya nitida, commonly known as the silky borya, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Borya nitida is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its delicate appearance and unique habitat make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
